article.headline: UAB 72, St. Louis 52
article.story: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. (AP) -- Mo Finley scored 23 points, 16 of them in the second half, to lead UAB to a 72-52 Conference USA victory over Saint Louis Saturday night. Demario Eddins and Donnell Taylor added 10 points each for UAB (13-5, 6-1). Reggie Bryant and Chris Sloan scored 14 points a piece to lead Saint Louis (11-7, 4-3). Saint Louis center Tom Frericks, who started his college career at UAB, had 6 points and a game-high 8 rebounds against his old team. The game matched two teams of differing styles, with UAB playing up tempo and Saint Louis preferring a more deliberate pace. UAB led 29-20 at halftime, but Saint Louis managed to keep the game at a fairly slow pace. Poor ball handling, particularly in the half court, hurt the Billikens. Saint Louis committed turnovers in its first five possessions of the second half. That helped UAB push its lead to 15 points. Saint Louis could get no closer than 10 points the rest of the way and finished with 25 turnovers. After Saint Louis closed within 47-37 with just under 10 minutes to play, Taylor hit two layups and Finley hit a pair of 3-pointers to break the game open to UAB. The Blazers eventually led by as many as 24 points.
